creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
in a web.xml, the servlet-class and servlet-mapping are correctly specified.

However, the .class file is missing in the .war.

Tomcat returns a 404.

Since this is a server-side misconfiguration, shouldn't it
1) rather give a 5?? error back to the browser?
2) add a corresponding log-line to the catalina.out (by default on)

Without taking a deeper look, so feel free to correct me.
if the .class file is missing for a servlet, the deployment of the webapp will
fail. since it can't call Servlet.init.
When the deployment fails, there is no webapp, hence tomcat will return a 404 as
the webapp itself is missing

your log files should contain the ClassNotFoundException
